function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Utilizing big data and technology may lead to privacy and data security risks, especially in the context of a pandemic.","Impact":"Violation of privacy, data breaches, and unauthorized use of personal information.","Mitigation":"Implementing robust data privacy policies, encryption of sensitive data, and obtaining explicit consent for data usage.","Technologies":"Data encryption, secure data storage solutions, and data anonymization techniques.","People":"Residents, consumers, and individuals whose data is being collected and processed.","Owner":"City governments, data protection authorities, and technology companies."},{"Description":"Relying heavily on digital solutions may exacerbate the digital divide and marginalize vulnerable populations who lack access to technology.","Impact":"Increased inequality, limited access to critical information and services, and social exclusion.","Mitigation":"Investing in digital literacy programs, providing access to affordable technology, and ensuring equal distribution of digital resources.","Technologies":"Digital inclusion initiatives, community technology centers, and affordable internet connectivity options.","People":"Underprivileged communities, elderly individuals, and low-income households.","Owner":"Government agencies, community organizations, and technology providers."},{"Description":"The rapid deployment of technology without proper testing and validation may lead to errors in decision-making and resource allocation.","Impact":"Inaccurate data analysis, misinformed policy decisions, and ineffective allocation of resources.","Mitigation":"Conducting thorough testing and validation of technological solutions, involving domain experts in decision-making, and implementing fail-safe mechanisms.","Technologies":"Simulation and modeling tools, validation protocols, and expert decision support systems.","People":"Public health officials, emergency responders, and policymakers.","Owner":"Technology developers, public health agencies, and government authorities."}]}
